MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Android.Content.BroadcastReceiver/PendingResult GoAsync() cil managed

Docs.summary: This can be called by an application in to allow it to keep the broadcast active after returning from that function.
Docs.returns: Returns a representing the result of the active broadcast. The BroadcastRecord itself is no longer active; all data and other interaction must go through APIs. The method must be called once processing of the broadcast is done.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Sets the flag indicating that this receiver should abort the current broadcast; only works with broadcasts sent through .

Docs.summary: Returns true if the receiver is currently processing the initial value of a sticky broadcast -- that is, the value that was last broadcast and is currently held in the sticky cache, so this is not directly the result of a broadcast right now.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns true if the receiver is currently processing an ordered broadcast.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetResult (Android.App.Result code, string data, Android.OS.Bundle extras);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetResult(valuetype Android.App.Result code, string data, class Android.OS.Bundle extras) cil managed
member this.SetResult : Android.App.Result * string * Android.OS.Bundle -> unit

Docs.param: The new result code. Often uses the Activity and constants, though the actual meaning of this value is ultimately up to the broadcaster.
The new result data. This is an arbitrary string whose interpretation is up to the broadcaster; may be null.
The new extra data map. This is a Bundle holding arbitrary data, whose interpretation is up to the broadcaster. Can be set to null. This completely replaces the current map (if any).
Docs.summary: Change all of the result data returned from this broadcasts; only works with broadcasts sent through .

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: The new extra data map; may be null.
Docs.summary: Change the current result extras of this broadcast; only works with broadcasts sent through .
